# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

# Solution

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, max_width=10)
    lines = split(text)
    wrapped_lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for line in lines
        if length(current_line) + length(line) > max_width
            push!(wrapped_lines, current_line * "
")
            current_line = ""
        end
        append!(current_line, line)
    end
    push!(wrapped_lines, current_line * "
")
    return join(wrapped_lines)
end
```
Example:
```julia
text = "Hello world. This is a test string to see how it wraps in different languages. It should wrap at the maximum width of 10 characters."
print(wrap_string(text, 10)) # Output: Hello
```
